hints.content:
We can think of $\purpleC{35}$ as $\purpleC{3\text{ tens}}$ and $\purpleC{5 \text{ ones}}$.  

We can think of $\blueD{16}$ as $\blueD{1\text{ ten}}$ and $\blueD{6\text{ ones}}$.

$\phantom{=}\purpleC{35}+\blueD{16}$

$=\purpleC{3\text{ tens}}+\purpleC{5\text{ ones}}+\blueD{1\text{ ten}}+\blueD{6\text{ ones}}$

$= \purpleC{3\text{ tens}}+\blueD{1\text{ ten}}+\purpleC{5\text{ ones}}+\blueD{6\text{ ones}}$
The answer: $3 \text{ tens}+1\text{ ten} +5\text{ ones}+6 \text{ ones}$

question.content:
**What do we get when we break apart $35+16$ using place value?**
